title: Bob Dudley brought BP back from the brink but a new horizon beckons
text:
If Dave Lewis is tetchy about Tesco’s lacklustre share price on his five-year watch, Bob Dudley must have banned all talk of it at BP. It was 440p when the New Yorker parachuted in to rescue the stricken oil giant in October 2010, and nine years later, as the 64 year-old prepares to stand down, the shares have bumped up to just 495p.

A paltry 12pc gain for what ranks as one of the toughest corporate salvage jobs of all time must feel like a whack round the head with a monkey wrench. Still, given that BP was brought to the brink of bankruptcy after the Obama administration shamelessly turned the Deepwater Horizon spill into a political football, shareholders should probably count their lucky stars...
